DOC.brief_summary: Dorsal clitoral artery Doppler examination woman bilateral internal iliac artery ligation due postpartum hemorrhage ( study group ) age-matched healthy puerperal woman perform regularly postoperative period , order evaluate possible effect BIIAL clitoral blood flow .
DOC.brief_title: Influence BIIAL Following PPH Dorsal Clitoral Artery Blood Flow FSFI
DOC.detailed_description: Women underwent bilateral internal iliac artery ligation due postpartum hemorrhage Gaziantep Cengiz Gokcek Maternity Hospital , Gaziantep Turkey Near East University , Department Obstetrics Gynecology , Mersin , Turkey comprise study group . The control group consist age-matched healthy woman deliver last 2 month . Dorsal clitoral artery Doppler examination perform case control group regularly postoperative period 3rd 6th month , order evaluate possible effect BIIAL clitoral blood flow . Ultrasound perform use Mindray DC-7 Ultrasound System ( China ) equip linear 7.5 MHz probe . Each woman scan gynecological position . The translabial probe place clitoris sagittally transversely without apply pressure force . After identify clitoral artery use colour flow mapping , Doppler probe position vessel least three sequential Doppler wave form obtain . The following parameter analyse : peak systolic velocity ( PSV ) , end diastolic velocity ( EDV ) , resistive index ( RI ) , pulsatile index ( PI ) systolic/diastolic ( S/D ) ratio . The measurement perform radiologist . Finally Female Sexual Fantasy Questionnaire ( FSFQ ) perform .
DOC.criteria: 1835 yearold woman underwent bilateral internal iliac artery ligation ( BIIAL ) due postpartum hemorrhage Agematched healthy puerperal woman Known Diabetes Melitus cardiovascular disease Known affection disorder pregnancy Blynch procedure , ligation uterine ovarian artery , hysterectomy salphingooophorectomy follow postpartum hemorrhage Known functional sexual disorder pregnancy Postoperative endometritis puerperal infection Postoperative thromboembolic incidence Cessation breastfeed puerperal period
